message: WATCH: I testified today before the House Energy and Commerce Subcommittee on Environment on behalf of Nevadans who reject Yucca Mountain.   I’m leading their fight. http://bit.ly/2pzVXjj

Interested in attending a U.S. Service Academy? My office makes several nominations a year for qualified Nevadans looking to serve their country.   Applications for Nevadans seeking a nomination are now available: http://bit.ly/2p3CPd4
Great week meeting with so many Nevadans to hear their concerns, ideas, and what we can do to tackle problems head on.
LIKE and SHARE this photo if you are supporting a Nevada small business for #SmallBusinessWeek
Just filed #NoBudgetNoPay as an amendment to spending bill. If Congress doesn’t do its job, we shouldn’t be paid.
Grateful to attend the 30th Annual James Hoff Memorial honoring the heroism of Nevada law enforcement and all of those who made the ultimate sacrifice.
VIDEO: Today on the Senate floor I discussed why Yucca Mountain could threaten the Las Vegas economy.  Watch below or go to: http://bit.ly/2pwrdw1
ICYMI: The tunnel collapse in Washington State is a reminder that Nevada cannot be the nation’s nuclear waste dump.
For #PoliceWeek2017, we pay tribute to those who lost their lives in the line of duty and are reminded of Nevada law enforcement's many sacrifices.
In honor of #PoliceWeek, I spoke on the Senate floor about Nevada's loss of North Las Vegas Detective Chad Parque.
Proud to introduce the Back the Blue Act in support of Nevada law enforcement.

It’s been more than 20 years since legislation to move the U.S. Embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem became law, yet we have still not fulfilled our commitment to Israel to do so. It’s time to act on our decades old promise and finally move the U.S. Embassy to Jerusalem and reaffirm to our strongest and oldest ally in the Middle East: the United States Senate stands with Israel.
Here's why storing nuclear waste in Yucca Mountain would endanger the entire country.
I introduced a bill with Senator Mark Warner to help families track down a missing loved one.
Great week meeting with so many Nevadans to hear their concerns, ideas, and what we can do to solve problems with commonsense solutions.
The Administration’s budget is anti-Nevada; it revives Yucca Mountain and cuts funding for critical Nevada programs:
Proud that our legislation to demand accountability at the VA is closer to becoming law.
Yucca Mountain will put taxpayers on the hook for billions of dollars.
I continue to fight in defense of critical Nevada public land programs.

As we approach Memorial Day, our nation once again has the opportunity to pause and pay tribute to the brave men and women in our military who made the ultimate sacrifice to keep America safe. While Memorial Day is specifically designated to honor those who have died while serving our country, it’s important that we never lose sight of the price our fallen heroes – and their loved ones – paid to defend our freedoms.
NEWS: Important legislation clears the Senate floor. Our bill will increase accountability at the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.
This Memorial Day, we’re all reminded that we owe a debt that can never fully be repaid.

It was humbling to see so many people across Northern Nevada come together to honor our fallen heroes this Memorial Day. We must never lose sight of the price our fallen heroes – and their loved ones – paid to defend our freedoms.
Too many veterans face homelessness and that’s why I’m defending programs that help those who have taken care of us.
I applaud the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs move to update its Electronic Health Records system. A step toward more timely care for veterans.
It’s time for the U.S. to fulfill its critical commitment and move our embassy to Jerusalem. #StandWithIsrael
I am seeking answers for Nevada on Yucca Mountain from the nominee to be deputy secretary for the U.S. Department of Energy.
I was humbled to travel to Normandy for D-Day's 70th Anniversary. Today, we again reflect on the bravery and sacrifices of those who fought.
Proud to see the Senate pass a bill that I cosponsored to provide more accountability to the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.
Just introduced a bipartisan bill with Senator Claire McCaskill and Senator Joni Ernst to better protect service members from exploitation.
Good to see that Secretary Ryan Zinke is giving Nevada a seat at the table as sage-grouse policy is reviewed.
I spoke with HHS Secretary Tom Price, M.D. about the effects health care reform could have on the state of Nevada.
I'm urging the Department of Homeland Security to ensure Las Vegas has the resources it needs to combat terrorism and protect the Nevada economy.
I am working to strengthen bipartisan legislation that will sanction Iran and hold the regime accountable.
The House of Representatives passed a bill I cosponsored to encourage accountability at the VA. It's now one step closer to becoming law.

I echo my colleagues' shock, sadness, and calls for unity following today's tragedy in Alexandria. I'm praying for the recovery of my friend Congressman Steve Scalise and all of those injured this morning, including two Capitol Police officers whose heroism likely saved many lives. The Capitol Police selflessly put their lives on the line every day, and I'm sincerely grateful for their sacrifice and commitment to keeping our community safe.
As the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs considers cuts to a critical program, I am speaking out on behalf of Nevada veterans. Watch:
Just introduced a bill to expand the GI benefits Nevada Guardsmen and Reservists receive for education & job training.

Throughout the health care debate, I have made clear that I want to make sure the rug is not pulled out from under Nevada or the more than 200,000 Nevadans who received insurance for the first time under Medicaid expansion. At first glance, I have serious concerns about the bill’s impact on the Nevadans who depend on Medicaid. I will read it, share it with Governor Sandoval, and continue to listen to Nevadans to determine the bill’s impact on our state. I will also post it to my website so that any Nevadans who wish to review it can do so. As I have consistently stated, if the bill is good for Nevada, I’ll vote for it and if it’s not – I won’t.  You can find the bill's text here: http://bit.ly/2rGO6xy

I applaud the President for signing our important bill to bring more accountability to the VA into law. This legislation is the product of strong bipartisanship in Congress, and I’m proud to have worked with Senator Rubio, Chairman Isakson, and Ranking Member Tester to deliver results for the 300,000 veterans living in Nevada and around the country. As a senior member of the Senate Veterans’ Affairs Committee, I will continue to work with veterans in our state to identify problems and develop solutions that will improve the care and strengthen the benefits our veterans expect and deserve.

As a senior member of the U.S. Senate Veterans’ Affairs Committee and Co-Chair of the Senate VA Backlog Working Group, I have been committed to expediting the VA’s disability claims process and eliminating the claims backlog. Unfortunately, while many veterans now receive a faster claim decision, it isn’t always accurate and they are forced to wait years to get through a cumbersome VA appeals process. I was proud to support the Appeals Improvement and Modernization Act, which would provide Nevada’s veterans with more options to appeal a case and put the VA on a path to a quicker, more efficient system that will ensure veterans are compensated for their injuries of war. I’ll continue to hold the VA’s feet to the fire when it comes to reducing the claims and appeals backlog and providing Nevada’s veterans quality and timely care.
Re-introduced a resolution with Senator Heidi Heitkamp to name June National Post-Traumatic Stress Awareness Month.
Thanks to all of the veterans who participated in today's roundtable in Reno. Bringing my notes back to Washington to turn your feedback into solutions to help Nevada's more than 300,000 veterans.
With my dog Noble in Reno for Noah's Animal House Groundbreaking yesterday. I am proud that Nevada is leading the way to help domestic violence victims.
Thanks to all veterans who participated in our roundtable in Las Vegas. It's always a valuable opportunity to identify problems and help find ways to help Nevada's veterans.

Fires across Northern Nevada have shut down highways, threatened homes and property, and put lives at risk. I want to thank our emergency responders who time and again run to – not away  from – danger. Our fire, police, and other emergency responders are working tirelessly to contain these wildfires. They risk their lives to protect others, and I am truly grateful for their service to our community. I also want to thank the federal, state and local officials for their work to keep these communities safe. We will continue to monitor these events closely throughout the weekend.
Honored to be in Sparks for this important day for our veterans, and to have worked with Governor Brian Sandoval and the community to advance the Northern Nevada Veterans Home.

Pleased that the U.S. Senate Energy and Water Appropriations Subcommittee excluded Yucca Mountain funding from the Senate’s Energy and Water spending bill. I will continue to stand with the State of Nevada every step of the way and reiterate to this administration and to my colleagues in Congress: Nevada will not serve as the nation’s nuclear waste dump. http://bit.ly/2tnX4ol
In an op-ed to the Elko Daily Free Press I discuss a bill signed into law to bring accountability to the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs for Nevada's veterans.

Obamacare isn’t the answer, but doing nothing to try to solve the problems it has created isn’t the answer either. That is why I voted to move forward and give us a chance to address the unworkable aspects of the law that have left many Nevadans - particularly those living in rural areas - with dwindling or no choices. Whether it’s my ideas to protect Nevadans who depend on Medicaid or the Graham-Cassidy proposal that empowers states and repeals the individual and employer mandates, there are commonsense solutions that could improve our health care system and today’s vote gives us the opportunity to fight for them. If the final product isn’t improved for the state of Nevada, then I will not vote for it; if it is improved, I will support it.

It seems clear to me that the plan proposed by Senators Graham and Cassidy is both the most conservative and workable solution. I signed onto their proposal because it returns power to the states and provides ultimate flexibility to governors and legislatures regardless of whether they expanded Medicaid or not. It recognizes Obamacare's failed one-size-fits-all approach and empowers states as decision-making will leave Washington. By allowing states to address the unique health care needs of their populations, it gives states the flexibility to innovate and come up with a tailored approach that is most appropriate for their citizens. In Nevada, this means supporting programs that are currently working in our state and exploring new options to address coverage and cost. The goal of health care reform should be to increase choice, lower costs, and improve the quality of care in this country, and I believe this proposal is the best way to go.
I just spoke on the Senate floor about the need to permanently repeal the Cadillac Tax. WATCH:
The VA Choice Program gives Nevada veterans access to life-saving treatment and they avoid having to travel hundreds of of miles for care:
Paul Laxalt was not only a mentor to me, but a Governor & Senator who blazed a trail for the Nevada conservative movement. Happy 95th Birthday!

Yesterday, the Senate passed the comprehensive #ForeverGIBill with my provisions to expand G.I. Bill benefits for many of Nevada’s veterans. Our bill makes much-needed updates for reservists, Purple Heart recipients, and veterans who face school closures while enrolled and surviving family members. The legislation also provides increased resources and authority for educational assistance to pursue science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) programs, computer programming and career technical training. This is yet another positive development for Nevada’s veterans, and I’ll continue to work to empower Nevada's veterans with more tools to succeed.

In response to catastrophic wildfires threatening communities across Northern Nevada, I recently introduced the Emergency Fuel Reduction Act to allow Nevada to better prepare before disaster strikes by speeding up the review process for critical wildfire prevention projects.

For veterans in northern parts of Nevada, like Reno, Sparks, and Carson City, it is unreasonable to expect these veterans to move 500 miles away from home to access the State Veterans Home in Boulder City…Plain and simple, the current formula does not take into account this geographical challenge, putting Nevada’s veterans at an unfair disadvantage. Our veterans deserve to have access to a benefit they have earned.

On #PurpleHeartDay, we honor the sacrifices of some of the best this country has to offer. That includes Ken, a Marine combat veteran from Reno, NV who was awarded two Purple Hearts for his courage on the battlefield during the Korean War. Ken was injured in September of 1950 during the Deliberation of Seoul and once again a month later during a battle in North Korea. Today and every day, it’s important that we remember the sacrifice of heroes like Ken whose bravery has allowed us to live in the freest nation on earth. Today is also a reminder that we owe all of those who answer the call to serve a debt that can never be repaid.
In case you missed it, KTVN Channel 2 News highlighted a bill that I introduced last week to speed up the review process for fire prevention projects to help prevent wildfires in Nevada.

Today I visited the Reno VA hospital and caught up with some veterans. By providing cutting-edge and comprehensive services to Nevada’s heroes, the Reno VA Medical Center is restoring our nation’s promise to support the men and women who have selflessly served this country. I’m proud to have worked with leaders at the Reno VA to secure critical federal funds that will help make this facility safer for our veteran patients and the doctors and staff who serve them. http://bit.ly/2vVCKuY

I was honored and humbled to attend the change of command ceremony for the Nevada Army Guard this weekend. Best of luck to Brigadier General Zachary Doser, who now assumes the command of more than 3,200 Nevada Army Guard soldiers. My sincere appreciation also goes out to Brigadier General Michael Hanifan, who served as commander since 2013 and will now become the Nevada Army Guard’s assistant adjutant general.

Just had a great discussion with leaders from the Latin, Asian, Urban, and Henderson Chambers on topics ranging from immigration to tax reform and creating good-paying jobs for Nevadans. Improving Nevada’s economy continues to be a top priority of mine and I’m encouraged by the efforts of these groups to boost Southern Nevada's communities.
BREAKING: The President just signed the #ForeverGIBill into law, a bill that I supported to expand education benefits for #NV vets.
Good questions and thoughtful discussion at the Hispanics in Politics meeting this morning. Thank you to Fernando and the Hispanics in Politics organization for putting together a great event.

Thankful for the leadership and selflessness of Nevada Task Force-1 as 18 of its volunteers deploy to Texas to assist with Hurricane Harvey.    “We risk a lot to save a lot,” Clark County Fire Department Chief John Steinbeck said Sunday as the task force readied for its mission. “It’s a daunting task, but it’s what they train for.”

Yesterday I was honored to have Treasury Secretary Mnuchin in Las Vegas to talk about the need for tax reform with some of Nevada’s top business leaders. When we lower rates for businesses, we give them the chance to better compete, allowing them to hire, invest, and expand – creating more jobs in our communities.

On the 16th anniversary of the September 11, 2001 terror attacks, we once again reflect on the thousands of lives lost, the immeasurable bravery of our first responders, and what makes each of us fortunate to call ourselves Americans: our flag and our values. The enemies of freedom who attacked our nation were met with an even stronger America and a new generation of soldiers who selflessly and readily answered the call to serve. Today, we’re reminded not only of what we felt on that brisk September day, but also that more unites us than divides us.

Last night the Senate passed two resolutions I supported recognizing #HispanicHeritageMonth. Nevada and this country are stronger because of our Latino community, and this month in particular we celebrate that.

Two bills I cosponsored to stop human trafficking in Nevada have been approved by the U.S. Senate. Our legislation is yet another step toward putting an end to this modern day slavery by strengthening prevention efforts at the federal level and keeping criminals who have already been convicted of this horrifying offense off of our roads and away from our kids.
Today we recognize and honor all American POWs & MIAs. You are not forgotten.

Happy 70th birthday to the U.S. Air Force! Thankful for the men & women who serve our country, including airmen at Creech Air Force Base and Nellis Air Force Base in Nevada, as well as those in the Nevada Air National Guard.

Fighting homelessness and building strong communities are priorities all Nevadans share, which is why I welcome the Department of Housing and Urban Development’s announcement that Nevada will receive $5.5 million in grant funds. By assisting with the development of local neighborhoods and emergency shelters, these grants will go a long way for families and individuals who need help the most.
To all celebrating Rosh Hashanah today in Nevada, Shanah Tovah! May you all have a Happy New Year!
My position remains clear: Yucca Mountain is dead. Read more about my submitted testimony to the U.S. House Oversight and Government Reform Subcommittee on the Interior, Energy, and Environment below

Nevada has been hit hard by veteran suicide. This morning at a U.S. Senate Veterans’ Affairs Committee hearing on the issue, I asked how families can be empowered to prevent veteran suicides and what can be done to reduce or prevent post-traumatic stress (PTS) during service. Rest assured I will never stop fighting for Nevada’s veterans.   Watch the clip by clicking here:

Had the pleasure of speaking to the Las Vegas Metro Chamber of Commerce this morning about what I'm doing to help boost Nevada's tourism, reduce burdensome regulations, and make it easier for our job creators to hire.

Congratulations to Shirley and Bill Wallin Elementary in Henderson, Thompson Elementary in Las Vegas, and Pinon Hills Elementary in Minden on their recognition as National Blue Ribbon Schools. Earning this recognition requires tremendous effort from all who work hard to ensure student achievement – the educators, the parents, and the students themselves. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2fB3D1q

Nevada families are waking up to the shocking news of the tragic events that occurred last night in Las Vegas. Our communities are all in mourning as we try to understand this senseless massacre on the Strip. I want to thank our first responders for their swift actions and efforts that without a doubt saved numerous lives. I’ve been in contact with the White House and Governor Sandoval, and I will continue to monitor the situation as this horrific event unfolds. Lynne and I are praying for all of the victims and their families who are experiencing immense pain and grave, shocking loss that cannot be measured.

If you are in Las Vegas, please consider donating blood. The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department has listed the following locations:   United Blood Services 601 Whitney Ranch Dr. Bldg. D, Ste 20 Henderson, NV  89014 (702) 434-1838  United Blood Services 6930 W. Charleston Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89117 (702) 228-4483

We’ll never forget October 1st, 2017. I’m very grateful to all of the first responders and everything that they have done. The help and support from people around the country, the number of phone calls that we have received, the condolences that are flowing into this community is second to none. I want to thank our whole congressional delegation for working together, linking arms and trying to move this community forward. Nevada is strong. Nevada will remain strong. We'll get through this and do it working together.

Sen. Cortez Masto and I urged the leaders of the commercial airline industry to implement various policy changes to aid the families of those affected by Sunday’s massacre at the Route 91 Harvest festival in Las Vegas. Read our bipartisan letter here: http://bit.ly/2yGTiog
So proud of the work that University Medical Center of Southern Nevada's nurses, doctors & medical staff are doing. Many of these professionals have been working around-the-clock.
Clark County Fire Chief Greg Cassell and his team were some of the first on the scene Sunday night. These heroes saved many lives and exemplify #VegasStrong. Thank you.

I just sent a letter to the U.S. Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) with eight Senators urging the Bureau to review the legality of bump stocks following the tragedy in Las Vegas. Read here: http://bit.ly/2yNDDUu

The Department of the Interior’s decision to reopen 10 million acres of federal lands in six Western states, including Nevada, is a win for the Silver State. By lifting restrictions on these federal lands, our state has the potential to create many more jobs for Nevadans through mining opportunities.

Very grateful to learn the U.S. Department of Justice will award $1 million to Nevada to help cover costs associated with law enforcement’s response to the tragedy in Las Vegas. I’m incredibly proud of our first responders who ran toward violence and chaos and undoubtedly saved many lives. Read more: http://bit.ly/2hBiUvP

This is what it means to be Battle Born. Thank you, Reno Fire Department, Truckee Meadows Fire Protection District and Sierra Front Interagency Dispatch for helping fight the multiple fires in California.

As fire crews continue to combat the scourge of wildfires across California and the West, my message to the Senate is clear: take action on my bill to prevent these deadly blazes. Read my letter to Senate leaders here: http://bit.ly/2yNHPHM

A new Las Vegas has risen in the aftermath of the October 1, 2017 shooting. I spoke on the Senate floor today to memorialize the victims, and pay tribute to the many heroes who emerged that night to help.

One of my greatest privileges in Congress is nominating Nevadans to the U.S. service academies. If you are a young man or woman in Nevada who is interested in attending the U.S. Air Force Academy, U.S. Military Academy, U.S. Naval Academy, or the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy make sure you meet the Oct. 31st deadline. For more information click here: http://bit.ly/2ziXHyg

Today is National Mammography Day. As someone with a family history of breast cancer, I know that early detection can save lives. That’s why I have authored legislation to help mobile mammography units serve women in Nevada and across the country. This Oct. 20th be sure to schedule a screening.

I joined Ivanka Trump and my colleagues today to discuss the importance of a bigger child tax credit. Nevada's hardworking families deserve tax relief and I will keep pushing Congress to deliver exactly that. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2yNKC0U

Humbled to have been amongst heroes at the Congressional Gold Medal Ceremony today honoring Filipino World War II veterans for their service to our country. I was able to recognize and thank Nevada’s own Sergeant Regalado Baldonado and his sister, Charmaine, who traveled for this incredible occasion. Sergeant Baldonado of Las Vegas was just 15 years old when he joined the Fil-American Army in 1942. Read more about the event here: http://bit.ly/2h8LMML

Yesterday I had the pleasure of meeting with Nevadans from the A Team, Opportunity Village, Easterseals Nevada, United Cerebral Palsy and High Sierra Industries. We talked about job-training and education...and I also got some great business cards!

We need to work day and night to confirm those judges that are already on our calendar and have moved out of the Senate Judiciary Committee. The Senate has an incredible opportunity right now to confirm federal judges who will uphold the Constitution. And we should be here every day, for as long as we need, to ensure all judicial vacancies are filled.

During a Congressional Gold Medal Ceremony honoring World War II Filipino and Filipino-American veterans, I had the pleasure of recognizing Sergeant Regalado Baldonado of Las Vegas, who is just one of four recognized Filipino-American veterans who reside in Nevada.

This week I joined Sen. Dianne Feinstein in introducing a bill to improve breast cancer detection. As someone with a family history of breast cancer, I understand how important it is to continue working to put an end to this horrible disease. With enough resources and more bipartisan action from Congress, I know that a cure is within our reach. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2xrznJX #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth
The Good Samaritan Search & Recovery Act deserves swift bipartisan approval by Congress. More on my bill here:

As many as 25 percent of domestic violence survivors have reported returning to an abusive partner out of concern for their pet. No victim of this crime should have to choose between their safety and the safety of their pet. That’s why I introduced the PAWS Act, a bill to protect victims of domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking and dating violence from emotional and psychological trauma caused by violence against their pets.
Congratulations to Nevada Guard's Sgt. Grant Reimers, who placed 2nd in the All-Army Best Warrior Competition! #BattleBorn
November is Military Family Appreciation Month. Thank you to all families and loved ones for carrying the load and supporting our troops.
Tune in to watch me speak about how tax relief will help Nevada’s hardworking families and small business owners.

My father was an auto mechanic and my mom was a school cook, and they had six children. They told us, “if you work hard and play by the rules, you will succeed and live the American dream.” The problem today is that many Americans don’t believe that anymore, and we need to change that. That’s why I joined U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, Counselor to the President Kellyanne Conway, Americans for Tax Reform President Grover Norquist, and others fighting for tax relief to highlight how Nevada’s hardworking families will benefit from tax cuts. The U.S. Senate should be working around the clock and through the weekends to pass tax relief, and I’m demanding that we don’t go home and do whatever it takes to get the job done.
My wife, Lynne, is singing the National Anthem at the Vietnam Veterans Memorial. Proud of her!

It is our responsibility to stand up for those who put their lives on the line for this country and provide them with the world class medical care they expect and deserve. My legislation will make sure of that by holding the VA’s feet to the fire so that the veterans the agency exists to serve have trust in their caretakers.

This weekend, we recognize the many brave men and women who sacrificed so much to defend our nation and uphold the American values of freedom and democracy. To the more than 300,000 veterans living in Nevada and all Nevadans who are currently serving in our Armed Forces - thank you, we owe you a debt that cannot be repaid. Your commitment, selfless service, and love of country will not be forgotten. The individual sacrifices made by our troops have built the foundation that has enabled the United States to stand as a beacon of freedom worldwide, and for that we are eternally grateful.

Today we honor the many brave men and women who sacrificed so much to defend our nation and uphold the American values of freedom and democracy. To the more than 300,000 veterans living in Nevada and all Nevadans who are currently serving in our Armed Forces - thank you. We must remember that the individual sacrifices made by our troops have built the foundation that has enabled the United States to stand as a beacon of freedom worldwide, and for that we are eternally grateful.
The original G.I. Bill was one of our country's greatest successes, and it's why I've worked to improve it for today's and tomorrow's generation of heroes.
Great time celebrating #VeteransDay this weekend in Nevada.

BREAKING: The updated Senate #taxrelief bill includes my and Senator Tim Scott's amendment that increases the child tax credit to $2,000 - that's 1,000 more than current law. I'm grateful for Ivanka Trump's leadership on this issue and appreciate her support. This is great news for hardworking Nevada families and Americans everywhere who desperately need a break.

FAKE NEWS. I am not interested in watering down the Second Amendment. The bill I signed onto today doesn’t expand existing gun law. Instead, the proposal would encourage federal agencies to fully enforce current laws related to reporting criminal history. This bill is supported by the National Rifle Association, National Shooting Sports Foundation, Fraternal Order of Police, National Sheriffs’ Association, National Network to End Domestic Violence, and National Coalition Against Domestic Violence. You can read more about the Fix NICS Act here: http://bit.ly/2AUy7RF

The Senate Finance Committee just passed the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, and that means that Congress is one step closer to delivering tax relief to middle-class families in Nevada and Americans everywhere. The proposal includes my and Senator Scott’s amendment to double child tax credit to $2,000 per child, an increase of $1,000 over current law. This change will significantly benefit thousands of Nevadans by allowing them to keep more of their hard-earned money, and will help families begin to confront the rising costs of raising their children. Whether it’s the single mother from Las Vegas who doesn’t receive child support, works full time, and is simply trying to make ends meet, or it’s the entrepreneur in Elko who’s fighting hard to get his small business off the ground, I will continue to stand up for Nevadans who deserve a break and fight to ensure that the final product puts Nevada first.

Great news for Lovelock: U.S. Department of Agriculture is providing Pershing General Hospital a $2.9 million low-interest loan for renovations. I appreciate Secretary Perdue's push to invest in rural health care, and I will continue to work to ensure that Nevadans living in rural areas are not overlooked. More here: http://bit.ly/2j6PfvA

Great news: The appropriations bill for the Interior Department, Environmental Protection Agency, and related agencies includes critical federal funding that I requested to help protect Lake Tahoe and detect wildfires in the region.

There is much to be thankful for as we count our blessings and celebrate Thanksgiving. I am truly grateful for our service members in the U.S. Armed Forces who are fighting for our country, for our law enforcement officers and first responders who work tirelessly to protect our communities, and for the many leaders and heroes who emerged to help those in need in the wake of the recent tragedy in Las Vegas.  As we gather around the table with our loved ones to celebrate Thanksgiving, I hope each and every Nevadan will take a few moments to express their deep appreciation for one another.   From my family to yours, I wish you a safe, happy, and peaceful Thanksgiving.
NA

The Senate’s Tax Cuts and Jobs Act just cleared a critical hurdle and we are now one step closer to providing tax relief to middle class families in Nevada and around the country. Read my statement here: bit.ly/2ApFljg
NA

Moments ago I introduced the CHIP Stability Act, legislation that will provide much-needed reassurances and federal funding to Nevada and other states for the Children’s Health Insurance Program. Read more about my bill here: http://bit.ly/2jBfaM0

BREAKING: The U.S. Senate just passed legislation that will deliver tax relief to hardworking Nevadans, boost middle class income by nearly $2,500, and add more than 8,300 jobs in Nevada. It also includes my provision that would increase the child tax credit from $1,000 to $2,000, or double it from current law. This bill will empower American families and help restore faith in the American dream by giving tax cuts to the middle class, creating jobs, and growing our economy. And I’m proud to have played a role in getting it passed.

So grateful for the Nevada National Guard & all they do to protect and serve Americans in Nevada and across the country. This year, they’ve activated more personnel for stateside response missions than any other year in history.

This bill is supported by more than 165 groups, including many sportsmen, recreation, conservation, and historic preservation groups, such as The Conservation Fund, The Trust for Public Land, Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation, Theodore Roosevelt Conservation Partnership, New Mexico Wildlife Federation, and Nevada Land Trust. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2jN8Z7C

As one of our strongest allies in the fight against terrorism and in promoting peace in the Middle East, America’s support to Israel must be unwavering. I applaud President Trump for his decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. I also welcome the Administration's commitment to developing a plan to relocate the American Embassy to Jerusalem, action that I have repeatedly pushed for because while a law was passed more than 20 years ago to do just that, it has never been enacted. That is why I have authored legislation that demands the United States no longer turns a blind eye to its promise. Today’s decision sends a message to our strongest and oldest ally in the Middle East: the United States Senate stands with Israel.

A date which will live in infamy.  Today, on the 76th anniversary of the #PearlHarbor attack, we remember the 2,403 American service members and civilians killed in a tragedy that spurred a generation of heroes to answer our nation’s call to serve in World War II.
Praying for all those impacted by the devastating California wildfires, and for the many Nevada firefighters helping battle the blazes.

Great news – the President today signed into law the CHIP Stability Act, legislation I introduced that ensures there is no gap in funding for the Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP). Read more here: http://bit.ly/2kdbv7h
Wishing families in Nevada and across the country a very Happy Hanukkah.
In case you missed it, my CHIP Stability Act was signed into law on Friday. Read more below:

Proud that the U.S. Senate voted to confirm yet another conservative judge. I’m hopeful that we’ll continue to fill the numerous judicial vacancies & bring #taxrelief to hardworking Americans. We need to work around the clock until we get the job done. http://bit.ly/2j2phtj

The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act will help boost jobs, increase wages, drive growth in our local communities, and provide middle-class families with the relief they desperately need. According to the independent Tax Foundation, a family of four that lives in Nevada and earns $77,000 annually is likely to see their tax liability reduced by approximately $2,180, or about 22 percent, under this bill. Additionally, the non-partisan Joint Committee on Taxation recently confirmed that it is likely that every income category of Nevada’s roughly 1.4 million individual tax return filers will receive a tax cut.  This tax relief plan is about ensuring middle-class families keep more of their hard-earned money, which is particularly important for the many Nevadans who are living paycheck to paycheck. I'm going to continue fighting on behalf of them and pushing my colleagues to work 24/7 until we get this done and sent to the President's desk for his signature.

Very proud of the work McCarran International Airport is doing to combat human trafficking. This is a vile crime that all airports must help fight against. Read more about McCarran International Airport's efforts here via The Wall Street Journal
This is great news – when #Nevada’s students succeed, we all succeed.

Whether it’s the single mother in Gardnerville who works full-time or the ambitious entrepreneur in Reno who started a business while going to school, Nevadans throughout the state will benefit from the passage of this historic legislation. At a time when Nevadans are bringing home less income than they were 10 years ago, childcare costs are skyrocketing, and too many Nevadans are living paycheck to paycheck, I understand just how critical it is that we provide tax relief for middle class families. From my provision to double the child tax credit from current law to lowering rates on middle-class families, our legislation gives Nevadans the break that they deserve by allowing them to keep more of their hard-earned money. This bill is about empowering middle-class families and restoring their faith in the American dream, and I look forward to seeing this legislation sent to the President’s desk later this week. https://t.co/bYhNoFxtYo

It was an honor to join President Trump and my colleagues today at the White House to highlight this once-in-a-generation tax relief bill that will give hardworking families in Nevada the tax cuts that they’ve been waiting for. Read more: http://bit.ly/2Di92Ba

Was honored to join Interior Secretary Zinke as he signed the secretarial order to expand critical minerals production. Nevada is one of the world’s largest sources of rare earth minerals. We produce over 80% of the gold mined domestically & we’re the 2nd largest producer of silver in the U.S.

I applaud the President for acting swiftly to sign into law tax relief legislation that will take effect January 1, 2018 because Nevadans can’t wait any longer for tax cuts. Americans are already feeling the positive impact of this bill given that immediately after its passage, several companies announced they plan to increase wages and give their employees bonuses. I encourage all Nevadans to compare their paychecks today to the ones they’ll receive in February; they’re going to be bigger because our bill allows you to keep more of your hard-earned money. This is particularly important at a time when nearly 8 in 10 Americans who work full-time are living paycheck to paycheck, Nevadans real median household income is down $7,000 from 10 years ago, and at a time when the cost of housing and childcare expenses continue to skyrocket.  Nevadans have been waiting for a break, and this is it. For example, this bill includes my provision to double the child tax credit from current law and provides relief to tens of thousands of Nevadans by eliminating Obamacare’s individual mandate tax penalty. From bringing Secretary Mnuchin to Nevada to hear directly from my constituents to working closely with Ivanka Trump to increase the child tax credit, I’ve made sure that Nevadans voices were heard by the Administration and my colleagues as we worked with the White House to put together and pass the first tax relief package in more than 30 years. Today is a good day for Nevadans and Americans everywhere. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2CZO9d1

HEADED TO THE PRESIDENT'S DESK: A bipartisan bill I helped introduce with Senator John Cornyn to give Nevada law enforcement more tools to reduce the backlog of untested rape kits, ensure critical evidence isn’t left uncovered, and deliver swift justice to victims of sexual assault. Read more about it here: http://bit.ly/2BpYaA5

For years, I've said that we need to cut regulatory red tape that inhibits mineral exploration and mine development projects in Nevada, and even introduced legislation that would do just that. So I was proud to join Secretary Zinke yesterday as he signed a secretarial order directing the first nationwide geological and topographical survey of the United States in modern history. This will put us on the path to ultimately reducing America’s reliance on foreign countries for critical minerals that are abundant in Nevada.

I’ve always said that we need less of Washington in Nevada, and that’s why I've fought to cut bureaucratic red tape that inhibits our job creators and the success of our communities. By reducing Obama-era bureaucratic red tape, we rejected the failed Washington-knows-best approach that has led to stagnant wages, slow economic growth, and too many Nevadans living paycheck to paycheck. I'm proud to have worked with my colleagues and the Administration to achieve historic regulatory reform, and I'll continue to push for solutions that will empower Nevadans - not Washington bureaucrats. Read more here: http://bit.ly/2Dln30j

From legislation that holds the VA accountable to a bill that encourages women entrepreneurship, I’m proud that the President signed more than a dozen bills that I helped introduce and pass. Read more about these 15 measures to help Nevadans here:

I’m incredibly proud that in addition to putting Justice Neil Gorsuch on the Supreme Court, the Senate broke a record for the number of circuit court judge nominees confirmed during the first year of President Trump’s Administration. This is exactly what the American people sent us to do – to deliver results – and that’s why I look forward to working with my colleagues in the New Year to maintain this pace and fill the numerous judicial vacancies.
